div.span: Don't have an account? Register now

p.a: Central Falls is Making Headlines. Click here to read the latest.
Our Commitment: From Clean Government to Clean Streets.
Improved Customer Service: payments now accepted online and with credit cards!

div.div:
Translate/Traducir/Traduzir
function googleTranslateElementInit() { new google.translate.TranslateElement({pageLanguage: 'en', layout: google.translate.TranslateElement.InlineLayout.SIMPLE}, 'google_translate_element'); }
COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus) Information
please click here
Important notice on City Services
We are operating by appointment only. To make an appointment or drop something off, please call the appropriate department (listed below) or the Mayor’s Hotline at 401-727-7474.
Estamos operando solo con cita previa. Para hacer una cita o dejar algo, llame al departamento correspondiente (que se detalla a continuación) o a la línea directa del alcalde al 401-727-7474.
Notice on Tax Collection Changes
Thank you for visiting the City of Central Falls’ website.
Central Falls is a city rich in history, diversity and entrepreneurial spirit. I encourage you to visit Central Falls in person to experience our great restaurants and shops in our walk-able business districts. Our great city is home to nineteen thousand proud residents who are busy building a better future for Central Falls; a future I invite you to experience today.
With a proud history starting in 1731, the City of Central Falls offers great opportunities for small business investment on our major thoroughfares. Centrally located in southern New England with easy access to Providence, Boston, Hartford and Worcester, the city features former mill space that hearkens back to its roots as the birthplace of the American Industrial Revolution; adding to the charm of the city.
The city’s diverse population offers an abundance of cultural riches – culinary, artistic, linguistic and beyond. At the same time, this wealth of diversity also provides bridges to nearly 100 countries abroad, allowing the city a unique opportunity to enjoy a wide array of cultural benefits.
Cogswell Tower in Jenks Park
Nestled between the City of Pawtucket and the Towns of Cumberland and Lincoln, the City of Central Falls is also compact. In fact, its 19,000+ citizens inhabit less than 1.3 square miles, making it quite walk-able as well as appealing for retailers. The city has recently focused on creating community gardens and sports fields wherever green space can be added to provide new communal spaces for our citizens and visitors alike to enjoy.
New Veterans Memorial Park
950-954 Dexter Street
Feel free to contact me by calling the Mayor’s Office at (401) 727-7474 or emailing me at mayor@centralfallsri.us.
Welcome to the City of Central Falls.
Thank you,
James A. Diossa
Looking for information about the City Council Meetings?
Click here to live stream the Central Falls City Council Meeting
Click here for minutes, agendas or videos from past meetings
Click here for videos of council meetings held before September 2018
Looking for the Adopted Budget?
Click here for Central Falls' FY20 Adopted Budget
Looking for a Job Opportunity in the City or to Bid?
Click here for Job Opportunities with the City of Central Falls
Click here for Invitations to Bids
Do you like this page?
